intro: Oxypolis longifolia, commonly known as longleaf oxypolis, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in late spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, often with a reddish hue on the underside. Oxypolis longifolia typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
